title: addurls: creates the -d dataset  to only fail by the end
body:
not yet sure if something for us todo (e.g. just fail if there is no dataset at that path, but we might have added that for a reason) but caused me some wasted time while I have not noticed that explicit `-d sub-XXX` was provided to `addurls` call in https://neurostars.org/t/datalad-addurls-errors-downloading-hbn-data/19725/4  , which then leads `addurls` to create a dataset there, and then fail by the end, since it would not be a proper subdataset (as added to the super dataset where I invoke it from).  

<details>
<summary>My short "failed to reproduce" attempt at reproducer</summary> 

```shell
$> datalad create  hbn; cd hbn        
[INFO   ] Creating a new annex repo at /tmp/hbn 
create(ok): /tmp/hbn (dataset)
(dev3) 1 20538 [1].....................................:Wed 07 Jul 2021 05:06:18 PM EDT:.
(git-annex)lena:/tmp/hbn[master]
$> echo -e "url\nhttps://manpages.debian.org/testing/git-annex/git-annex.1.en.html" >| /tmp/urls.csv
(dev3) 1 20539 [1].....................................:Wed 07 Jul 2021 05:06:23 PM EDT:.
(git-annex)lena:/tmp/hbn[master]
$> datalad addurls -d subds-kinda ../urls.csv '{url}' '{_url_filename}'                             
[INFO   ] Creating a new annex repo at /tmp/hbn/subds-kinda                                               
create(ok): . (dataset)
addurl(ok): /tmp/hbn/subds-kinda/git-annex.1.en.html (file) [to git-annex.1.en.html]                      
save(ok): . (dataset)                                                                                     
action summary:                                                                                           
  addurl (ok: 1)
  create (ok: 1)
  save (ok: 1)
```
</details>

so full reproducer would be to follow the example on neurostars
